sen.j: 喜多 実（きた みのる、1900年（明治33年）2月23日 - 1986年（昭和61年）10月2日）は、シテ方喜多流能楽師で、喜多流十五世宗家。
sen.e: Minoru KITA (February 23, 1900 to October 2, 1986) was a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kita school (one of the five schools of shite-kata [main roles]), and the 15th head of the leading family in the Kita school.

Minoru KITA (February 23, 1900 to October 2, 1986) was a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kita school (one of the five schools of shite-kata [main roles]), and the 15th Soke (headmaster of the head family) in the Kita school.
sen.cmt: Sokeという用語でWikipediaに登用されている。元の単語に興味を覚える読者がいるかもしれない、その場合アルファベット入力しても調べることが可能だということなので、Head～以降を括弧でくくり解説化するという対応にした。また、Headmaster のほうが「宗家」にはふさわしいのではないか(以下リンク参照)。leading familyとhead family―どちらも使える気がするが、「ゆらぎ」がより少ないのは後者のようなので、こちらにした。 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C5%8Dke http://eow.alc.co.jp/%E5%AE%97%E5%AE%B6/UTF-8/?ref=sa
sen.e: Minoru KITA (February 23, 1900 to October 2, 1986) was a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kita school (one of the five schools of shite-kata [main roles]), and the 15th Soke (headmaster of the head family) in the Kita school.
A member of the Japan Art Academy.
A member of the Japan Art Academy.
He was a member of the Japan Art Academy.
He was from Shiga Prefecture.
He was from Shiga Prefecture.
He was from Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 5歳の時、大阪の後藤家から喜多流喜多六平太 (14世)の養子に入る。
sen.e: At the age of five, he was adopted from the Goto family in Osaka by Roppeita KITA (14th) of the Kita school
At the age of five, he was adopted from the Goto family in Osaka by Roppeita KITA (14th) of the Kita school
At the age of five, he was adopted from the Goto family in Osaka by Roppeita KITA (14th) of the Kita school

sen.j: 1939年より土岐善麿とともに新作能の活動を行う。
sen.e: In 1939, he started performing new Noh dramas together with Zenmaro TOKI.
In 1939, he started performing new Noh dramas together with Zenmaro TOKI.
In 1939, he started performing new Noh dramas together with Zenmaro TOKI.

sen.j: イタリア、パリなどで公演を行い、57年重要無形文化財（人間国宝）。
sen.e: Visiting overseas such as Italy and Paris for performances, he was designated as Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1957.
Visiting overseas such as Italy and Paris for performances, he was designated as the Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1957.
sen.cmt: the Important Intangible Cultural Propertyのほうが適切だと思われます。
sen.e: Visiting overseas such as Italy and Paris for performances, he was designated as the Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1957.

sen.j: 71年六平太死去を受けて喜多流15世家元となる。
sen.e: In 1971, when Roppeita died, he became the 15th headmaster of the Kita school.
In 1971, when Roppeita died, he became the 15th headmaster of the Kita school.
In 1971, when Roppeita died, he became the 15th headmaster of the Kita school.
In 1974, he assumed the post of chairman of the Nohgaku Performers' Association.
sen.cmt: 日本能楽協会には英語のサイトがなく確認できませんでしたが、ウィーン公演のお知らせにあった英語名称には、日本が入っていませんので、確認できた名称にしてあります。
sen.e: In 1974, he assumed the post of chairman of the Nohgaku Performers' Association.
In 1974, he assumed the post of chairman of the Nohgaku Performers' Association.

sen.j: 75年日本芸術院賞受賞、芸術院会員。
sen.e: In 1975, he received the Award of the Japan Art Academy, and became a member of the Japan Art Academy,.
In 1975, he received the Award of the Japan Art Academy, and became a member of the Japan Art Academy,.
In 1975, he received the Award of the Japan Art Academy, and became a member of the Japan Art Academy,.
In 1976, he was granted the Third Class of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.
In 1976, he was granted the Third Class of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.
In 1976, he was granted the Third Class of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.

sen.j: 兄に俳人後藤夜半（やはん）、シテ方喜多流能楽師で人間国宝の後藤得三。
sen.e: Yahan GOTO, a haiku poet, and Tokuzo GOTO, a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kita school and Living National Treasure, are his older brothers.
Yahan GOTO, a haiku poet, and Tokuzo GOTO, a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kita school and Living National Treasure, are his older brothers.
Yahan GOTO, a haiku poet, and Tokuzo GOTO, a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kita school and Living National Treasure, are his older brothers.

sen.j: 子に喜多流喜多六平太 (16世)、喜多節世。
sen.e: Roppeita KITA, a Noh actor (the 16th headmaster) of the Kita school, and Sadayo KITA are his children.
Roppeita KITA, a Noh actor (the 16th headmaster) of the Kita school, and Sadayo KITA are his children.
Roppeita KITA, a Noh actor (the 16th headmaster) of the Kita school, and Sadayo KITA are his children.
